issue.title: Gazebo does not like tiny robots

content.raw:
About small masses showing as 0.00 kg, it seems to be only a problem with precision on the GUI display. I just made a simple model with mass equals to 1e-5 Kg and it falls with gravity using ODE:

~~~
<?xml version='1.0'?>
<sdf version='1.5'>
  <model name='Untitled'>
    <link name='link_0'>
      <inertial>
        <mass>1e-05</mass>
      </inertial>
      <visual name='visual'>
        <geometry>
          <sphere>
            <radius>0.5</radius>
          </sphere>
        </geometry>
      </visual>
      <collision name='collision'>
        <geometry>
          <sphere>
            <radius>0.5</radius>
          </sphere>
        </geometry>
      </collision>
    </link>
  </model>
</sdf>
~~~
content.html:
About small masses showing as 0.00 kg, it seems to be only a problem with precision on the GUI display. I just made a simple model with mass equals to 1e-5 Kg and it falls with gravity using ODE:

<?xml version='1.0'?>
<sdf version='1.5'>
  <model name='Untitled'>
    <link name='link_0'>
      <inertial>
        <mass>1e-05</mass>
      </inertial>
      <visual name='visual'>
        <geometry>
          <sphere>
            <radius>0.5</radius>
          </sphere>
        </geometry>
      </visual>
      <collision name='collision'>
        <geometry>
          <sphere>
            <radius>0.5</radius>
          </sphere>
        </geometry>
      </collision>
    </link>
  </model>
</sdf>

issue.title: Gazebo does not like tiny robots

content.raw:
Hmm, okay hmm I just assumed that the mass was being incorrectly parsed. Regardless, that is a GUI feature which should be fixed. Additionally, if there are any parameters that can make the physics engine play nicely with small objects it would be awesome if they could be included in the SDF file. 

On second thought I had it attached to a hinge so maybe there is some default stiffness value in ODE that won't allow it to bend if it weighs less than that despite not having any such value visible through the SDF file.
content.html:
Hmm, okay hmm I just assumed that the mass was being incorrectly parsed. Regardless, that is a GUI feature which should be fixed. Additionally, if there are any parameters that can make the physics engine play nicely with small objects it would be awesome if they could be included in the SDF file.

On second thought I had it attached to a hinge so maybe there is some default stiffness value in ODE that won't allow it to bend if it weighs less than that despite not having any such value visible through the SDF file.

issue.title: Gazebo does not like tiny robots

content.raw: I created issue #1647 specifically for the number of decimals displayed. Afterwards I saw there was already a similar issue (#169) for editable properties (like pose).
content.html: I created issue #1647 specifically for the number of decimals displayed. Afterwards I saw there was already a similar issue (#169) for editable properties (like pose).
